cyclone.name: HANNA
cyclone.current_location: about 405 miles ESE of Port O'Connor, TX
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the north-western Gulf of Mexico toward the central Texas coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Port O'Connor / Matagorda Bay, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Mansfield to High Island, TX (tropical-storm watch area)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Texas coast from Port Mansfield northward to High Island with heavy rain spreading into Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions with occasional tropical-storm-force gusts possible (25–35 mph)
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge/swells 1–2 ft above normal tides possible along adjacent beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated higher pockets up to 8 inches could trigger flash flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and elevated surf along upper Texas coast
